#Text=5 .
#Text=ZAEMON’S CURSE
#Text=It appeared that for the present at any rate I was to have my residence in the royal pyramid .
#Text=The glittering cavalcade drew up in the great paved square which lies before the building , and massed itself in groups .

#Text=The mammoth was halted before the doorway , and when a stair had been brought , the trumpets sounded , and we three who had ridden in the golden half-castle under the canopy of snakes , descended to the ground .

#Text=It was plain that we were going from beneath the open sky to the apartments which lay inside the vast stone mazes of the pyramid , and without thinking , the instinct of custom and reverence that had become part of my nature caused me to turn to where the towering rocks of the Sacred Mountain frowned above the city , and make the usual obeisance , and offer up in silence the prescribed prayer .

#Text=I say I did this thing unthinking , and as a matter of common custom , but when I rose to my feet , I could have sworn I heard a titter of laughter from somewhere in that fancifully bedecked crowd of onlookers .
#Text=I glanced in the direction of the scoffers , frowningly enough , and then I turned to Phorenice to demand their prompt punishment for the disrespect .
#Text=But here was a strange thing .
#Text=I had looked to see her in the act and article of rising from an obeisance ; but there she was , standing erect , and had clearly never touched her forehead to the ground .
#Text=Moreover , she was regarding me with a queer look which I could not fathom .
#Text=But whatever was in her mind , she had no plan to bawl about it then before the people collected in the square .
#Text=She said to me , “ Come , ” and , turning to the doorway , cried for entrance , giving the secret word appointed for the day .

#Text=The ponderous stone blocks , which barred the porch , swung back on their hinges , and with stately tread she passed out of the hot sunshine into the cool gloom beyond , with the fan-girl following decorously at her heels .
#Text=With a heaviness beginning to grow at my heart , I too went inside the pyramid , and the stone doors , with a sullen thud , closed behind us .
#Text=We did not go far just then .
#Text=Phorenice halted in the hall of waiting .

#Text=How well I remembered the place , with the pictures of kings on its red walls , and the burning fountain of earth-breath which blazed from a jet of bronze in the middle of the flooring and gave it light .
#Text=The old King that was gone had come this far of his complaisance when he bade me farewell as I set out twenty years before for my vice-royalty in Yucatan .
#Text=But the air of the hall was different to what it had been in those old days .
#Text=Then it was pure and sweet .
#Text=Now it was heavy with some scent , and I found it languid and oppressive .
#Text=“ My minister , ” said the Empress ,
#Text=“ I acquit you of intentional insult ; but I think the colonial air has made you a very simple man .
#Text=Such an obeisance as you showed to that mountain not a minute since has not been made since I was sent to reign over this kingdom . ”
#Text=“ Your Majesty , ” I said ,
#Text=“ I am a member of the Priests ’ Clan and was brought up in their tenets .
#Text=I have been taught , before entering a house , to thank the Gods , and more especially our Lord the Sun , for the good air that He and They have provided .

#Text=It has been my fate more than once to be chased by streams of fire and stinking air amongst the mountains during one of their sudden boils , and so I can say the prescribed prayer upon this matter straight from my heart . ”
#Text=“ Circumstances have changed since you left Atlantis , ” said Phorenice , “ and when thanks are given now , they are not thrown at those old Gods . ”
#Text=I saw her meaning , and almost started at the impiety of it .
#Text=If this was to be the new rule of things , I would have no hand in it .
#Text=Fate might deal with me as it chose .

#Text=To serve truly a reigning monarch , that I was prepared for ; but to palter with sacrilege , and accept a swineherd ’s daughter as a God , who should receive prayers and obeisances , revolted my manhood .
#Text=So I invited a crisis .
#Text=“ Phorenice , ” I said ,
#Text=“ I have been a priest from my childhood up , revering the Gods , and growing intimate with their mysteries .
#Text=Till I find for myself that those old things are false , I must stand by that allegiance , and if there is a cost for this faithfulness I must pay it . ”
#Text=She looked at me with a slow smile .
#Text=“ You are a strong man , Deucalion , ” she said .
#Text=I bowed .
#Text=“ I have heard others as stubborn , ” she said , “ but they were converted . ”
#Text=She shook out the ruddy bunches of her hair , and stood so that the light of the burning earth-breath might fall on the loveliness of her face and form .
#Text=“ I have found it as easy to convert the stubborn as to burn them .
#Text=Indeed , there has been little talk of burning .
#Text=They have all rushed to conversion , whether I would or no .
#Text=But it seems that my poor looks and tongue are wanting in charm to-day . ”
